import React from 'react'; import "./pages.css"; import {Col} from "react-bootstrap"; import {Link} from "react-router-dom" var satu = "https://www.satulankinen.fi/"; var canario_passarinho = "https://www.recantocaipira.com.br/duplas/canario_passarinho/canario_passarinho.html"; var dream = "https://medium.com/@pedro.bergamo/my-dream-as-a-composer-96f8b9903ba0"; var flotation = "http://flotation-simulator.com"; var simulation = "https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S089268752100501X"; const Santeros = () => { return(

It all started with a melody he heard in a dream. After that, a 15 year old Pedro Bergamo got involved with the church, composing gospel music for his worship group and studying hard to become a pastor. He would probably be living a very different life if it was not for the ghosts and demons that haunted the halls of his mind. There was a force that dragged him out of that environment, which had become his safe haven. A "l'appel du vide" sort of thing. In his 17s, Pedro left the church and dived deep into mysticism, just like a pendul moves to the oposite extreme when released. He moved to São Paulo and joined as the lead singer in a hard rock band, playing in a couple bars and festivals. He started composing rock music in English, and at some point the band was solely playing his compositions. But his trouble with alcohol and a near death experience led him to give up the project and return to his hometown to live with his biological father. His father had plans to turn him into a star of Sertanejo (Brazilian Country music), just like himself knew. He bought him a viola caipira, and Pedro came up with a repertoire mostly played during barbecues to entertain his grandfather, which he always had a strong bond with. At this point he also started composing some Brazilian music in the viola caipira, experimenting writing in Portuguese for the first time after leaving the church. But he never really thought of it as a profession. Instead, he was looking for something deeper and more meaningful, like a monk or a martial arts teacher. One day, he saw a book in his friend's house. It was a book about magic and Pedro asked if he could borrow. The magic of the book, for his disappointment, was not the same as Aleister Crowley's or Eliphas Levi's. It was a book full of magic tricks. One of the magic tricks, however, related to the use of a compound to make a hand writing disappear in paper, sparked his interest in Chemistry. So when he was 22 he enrolled in a chemistry program, obtaining the title of Master of Science in 2017 and moving to Finland to pursue a Ph.D.. During the next 4 years he would develop simulators and games to teach the chemistry related to flotation, as also write scientific papers on the subject.

In 2020, after 4 years away from home, he received the news that his beloved grandfather died, which made him question many of his life choices. Looking for ways to deal with the grief, he revisited the Brazilian music he composed in his early 20s and during his vacation he visited a friend in São Paulo, recording some of them using solely Brazilian instruments. Back in Finland, he saw an advertising in Muusikoiden.net of a latin band, and he joined as the lead singer. There he met Satu, Seppo and Rolando where he practiced those songs for the first time with a band, together with some other covers. After some gigs, Rolando suggested that Pedro should have his own band focusing on his original compositions. They invited Satu in the accordion and named the band "Los Santeros". Seppo Salmi (from the former Soul Captain Band) joined the band in the guitar and they renamed it to "Pedro Bergamo & Los Santeros", since there was an American band also called "Los Santeros". After trying out with some bassists, Pedro's girlfriend suggested a friend from her music school who also composed Brazilian/Jazz music. After releasing some singles, they had their first gig in Helsinki. Right now they are in the process of producing their debut album.

Contact for gigs:

phone: (+358)406740101

email: pedrobergamo89@gmail.com

"Soulfull, mystical and danceable. It is like a cool gypsy band. A hidden gem in Helsinki that everyone should know about!" - Elina

Los Santeros is composed by

Pedro Bergamo - Acoustic Guitar & Backing Vocals

Satu Lankinen - Accordion & Vocals

Seppo Salmi - Electric Guitar

Max Loponen - Bass

Rolando Camilo - Drums & Backing Vocals

); }; export default Santeros;
